Detailed Description

Provides an easy to use interface to control the iiwa in combination with MoveIt!.

All public methods are virtual, so that derived classes can overwrite them in case they need modified versions.

Definition at line 56 of file robot_interface.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

iimoveit::RobotInterface::RobotInterface ( ros::NodeHandle *  node_handle,
const std::string &  planning_group,
const std::vector< double > &  base_pose 
)

Constructs a new RobotInterface with the given parameters.

Parameters
node_handleThe NodeHandle used to publish and subscribe to topics.
planning_groupThe planning group/joint model group to plan for.
base_poseBase pose in joint space coordinates (for tasks where robot often returns to one pose).

Definition at line 44 of file robot_interface.cpp.

iimoveit::RobotInterface::RobotInterface ( ros::NodeHandle *  node_handle,
const std::string &  planning_group,
const std::string &  base_frame = std::string("iiwa_link_0") 
)

Constructor that assumes all joint angles as 0.0 for the base pose.

Parameters
node_handleThe NodeHandle used to publish and subscribe to topics.
planning_groupThe planning group/joint model group to plan for.
!DEPRECATED!We suggest not to use this parameter at all as it might be removed in future versions. It does not have any effect anymore.

Definition at line 64 of file robot_interface.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

void iimoveit::RobotInterface::buttonEventCallback ( const std_msgs::String::ConstPtr &  msg)
virtual

This callback function is called whenever one of the buttons on the SmartPad is pressed.

To make it useful, a class should be derived from RobotInterface and the callback function overwritten to something useful. For the buttons to be shown on the SmartPad, they have to be configured via a launch file (like in iiwa_stack/iiwa_ros/launch/toolbar_example.launch) prior to the RosSmartServo application being launched on the iiwa!

Parameters
msgA string containing information about which button was pressed or released.

Returns the current cartesian Pose.

Parameters

Returns

Definition at line 304 of file robot_interface.cpp.

void iimoveit::RobotInterface::planAndMove ( const geometry_msgs::Pose &  target_pose,
bool  approvalRequired = true,
const std::string &  pose_name = std::string("given pose") 
)
virtual

Plans a motion to a given endeffector pose.

It will show the planned trajectory in RViz and, if approvalRequired is set to true, will ask for confirmation before moving to the goal.

Parameters
target_poseThe pose goal.
pose_nameThe name of the pose that will be shown in RViz.
approvalRequiredIf set to true, it will only move after confirmation in RViz.

)

Definition at line 148 of file robot_interface.cpp.

void iimoveit::RobotInterface::planAndMoveInGivenCoordSys ( const geometry_msgs::PoseStamped &  first_pose,
double  px,
double  py,
double  pz,
double  rx,
double  ry,
double  rz,
double  rw,
bool  approvalRequired = true 
)
virtual

!UNTESTED! Plans a motion to a pose given in another coordinate frame.

The coordinates of the second pose will be interpreted with the first pose as origin. This method is called by the other ones that plan in a different coordinate system like the current tool pose or the base pose.

Parameters
first_poseThe first pose. The pose given with the other parameters will be concatenated onto this one.
pxThe translation in x-direction of the second pose.
pyThe translation in y-direction of the second pose.
pzThe translation in z-direction of the second pose.
rxThe x-component of the quaternion of the second pose.
ryThe y-component of the quaternion of the second pose.
rzThe z-component of the quaternion of the second pose.
rwThe w-component of the quaternion of the second pose.
approvalRequiredIf set to true, it will only move after confirmation in RViz.

Definition at line 181 of file robot_interface.cpp.

void iimoveit::RobotInterface::planAndMoveRelativeToGivenPose ( const geometry_msgs::PoseStamped &  first_pose,
double  px,
double  py,
double  pz,
double  rx,
double  ry,
double  rz,
double  rw,
bool  approvalRequired = true 
)
virtual

Plans a motion relative to a given pose and moves to it.

The coordinates of the second pose will still be interpreted in the world frame. Only the orientation of both will be concatenated. This method is called by the ones that plan relative to the current pose or base pose.

Parameters
first_poseThe first pose.
pxThe translation in x-direction of the second pose.
pyThe translation in y-direction of the second pose.
pzThe translation in z-direction of the second pose.
rxThe x-component of the quaternion of the second pose.
ryThe y-component of the quaternion of the second pose.
rzThe z-component of the quaternion of the second pose.
rwThe w-component of the quaternion of the second pose.
approvalRequiredIf set to true, it will only move after confirmation in RViz.

Parameters

Definition at line 275 of file robot_interface.cpp.

void iimoveit::RobotInterface::publishPoseGoal ( const geometry_msgs::Pose &  target_pose,
double  duration 
)
virtual

Publishes a Pose to the command topic of the controller.

This has to be used with care, as this method does not check whether the robot is close to the starting point of the trajectory. As the command topic expects trajectory messages, the pose will be put in a trajectory containing this single pose.

Parameters
target_poseThe pose to publish.
durationThe duration value of the trajectory message.

Definition at line 244 of file robot_interface.cpp.

void iimoveit::RobotInterface::publishPoseGoal ( const geometry_msgs::PoseStamped &  target_pose,
double  duration 
)
virtual

void iimoveit::RobotInterface::publishTrajectory ( const trajectory_msgs::JointTrajectory &  trajectory)
virtual

Publishes a joint trajectory to the command topic of the controller.

This has to be used with care, as this method does not check whether the robot is close to the starting point of the trajectory.

Parameters
trajectoryThe trajectory to publish.

bool iimoveit::RobotInterface::runTrajectoryAction ( const trajectory_msgs::JointTrajectory &  trajectory)
virtual

Runs a joint trajectory action and waits for the robot to finish.

This has to be used with care, as this method does not check whether the robot is close to the starting point of the trajectory.

Parameters
trajectoryThe trajectory.
